programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily

programme.title: The Circuit

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Doc buys a gold brick stolen from a stagecoach and tries to use it to prove the honest citizens of Dodge City are not so honest.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A series of shootings near the home of Myra Malone, a dressmaker, and a warning to a rancher courting Myra forces Earp to investigate.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Morgan Earp, Wyatt's younger brother, arrives in Dodge City wanting to be a deputy marshal with Wyatt. Wyatt believes it is too dangerous but pressure from Doc forces Wyatt to reconsider.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: The owner of the Big T Rance Purcell and his foreman Gus Andrews trap Earp alone at Stony Wells. Earp outnumbered 30 to 1 is running out of water and ammo.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Mayor Hoover declines to run for mayor, so Judge Tobin with Earp's support asks Jim Kelley to run against Slip Madigan. Earp decides to resign to ensure Kelley's election.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Dr. Fabrique visits Wichita hoping for a fishing vacation. With Dr. McCarty out of town, Fabrique is forced to tend to a cattle baron's stomach ache at gunpoint.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Doc stirs up trouble when he tells Miss Pinky Dodge City can't collect taxes from them as they aren't part of the city.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At a coffee shop in Washington, DC, three employees were shot to death. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong or an act of cold-blooded vengeance?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Buffalo, New York, a sniper targeted African-American men. He held a city hostage, and threatened to ignite a racial powder keg. And it looked like others might be following his bloody example.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Etna, New Hampshire is a small town. It's the kind of place where people trust their neighbors and leave their doors unlocked. A double murder shattered that trust and left the entire community terrified.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980's the federal penitentiary in Atlanta held some of the country's most notorious prisoners. Castro called them undesirables. The U.S. government called them detainees. In 1987 they staged a bloody revolt.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: New York City is not stranger to gang violence. But when a 12-year-old child was kidnapped, the gangs had crossed a line. Law enforcement raced to find the missing boy before it was too late.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: The show examines cases of poison and deadly chemistry and shows how forensic experts are solving mysterious deaths today and from the past.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: Formed in the 1830s to protect settlers against Indian attack, the Rangers became part of the Texas Highway Patrol in 1935. Their role has continued to evolve to keep up with changing times; today it includes sophisticated forensics labs.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: Terrorism: Thanks to new technology and, perhaps, the approaching millennium, terrorism is a growing international threat. The Oklahoma City explosion and the bombing of the World Trade Center are just two of the incidents of this growing problem.

programme.title: The New Detectives

programme.title: South Park: Cartman adhère à la Nambla

programme.title: South Park: Tampons en Cheveux de Cherok

programme.title: South Park: Chef Pète les Plombs
